definition: (of waves) to surge forward/to roll on in waves/to gallop
to hurry/to rush/to run quickly/to elope
variant of 奔[ben1]/variant of 奔[ben4]
to soar/to gallop/to prance/to turn over/to vacate/to clear
lit. ten thousand stampeding horses (idiom)/fig. with great momentum/going full speed ahead

sentences.english: The small boat could not stem the rushing tide.
sentences.chinese: 这艘小船顶不住汹涌奔腾的潮水。

sentences.english: Like the Yellow River,time keeps rolling along.
sentences.chinese: 时间像黄河一样不断滚滚奔腾向前。

sentences.english: I hear phrases, musical ideas rushing forth and thrusting forward.
sentences.chinese: 我听到了乐节，向前奔腾和推进的音乐理念。

sentences.english: Now, you can buy a pentium IV for only several thousand yuan.
sentences.chinese: 现在你只需要花几千元就能买到奔腾IV了。

sentences.english: That wave for dash about, the sharp of the innumerable.
sentences.chinese: 那奔腾的海浪，无数的尖锋。

sentences.english: Sound like force of a thunderbolt, potential, such as full steam ahead.
sentences.chinese: 声似雷霆万钧，势如万马奔腾。

sentences.english: The infinite sky is motionless overhead and the restless water is boisterous.
sentences.chinese: 头上是静止的无垠的天空，不宁的海波奔腾喧闹。

sentences.english: The surge in the Yangtze and yellow rivers of blood pentium wave wave.
sentences.chinese: 涌动的血液奔腾着长江黄河的浪波。

sentences.english: I shall roll on and on, and break upon your lap with laugher.
sentences.chinese: 我奔腾前进，大笑着撞碎在你的膝上。

sentences.english: It was the noise of trotting horses.
sentences.chinese: 原来是马儿奔腾的声音。

sentences.english: The Yellow River rolls on day and night.
sentences.chinese: 黄河日日夜夜地奔腾不息。

sentences.english: The floods surged over the valley.
sentences.chinese: 洪水奔腾澎湃漫过溪谷。

sentences.english: "Painting Mountain" cliff face Jiang standing Pentium wall seems to be a mighty force.
sentences.chinese: “画山”峭壁面江而立，壁上似有千军万马奔腾。

sentences.english: The Yellow River surges onward like ten thousand horses galloping.
sentences.chinese: 黄河以万马奔腾之势滚滚向前。

sentences.english: The scene of thousands of steeds galloping I would never forget all my life.
sentences.chinese: 那万马奔腾的场面我这一辈子也忘不了。

sentences.english: Very fast, the husband gallops in passion in reach a climax.
sentences.chinese: 很快，丈夫便在激情奔腾中达到高潮。

definition: to flow at great speed/to pour/racing current
lit. ten thousand stampeding horses (idiom)/fig. with great momentum/going full speed ahead
to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
vast and mighty (of river or ocean)/broad and powerful
to rage/to dash/to surge/also written 激盪|激荡
to roll over and over (of billows or clouds)
to turn over/to surge/to churn/to rummage/raging (torrent)
